content.title: Rivaroxaban in Vascular Disease
content.description: Direct oral anticoagulant (DOAC) with direct factor Xa inhibition, increasingly used in PAD and post-revascularization settings.
content.mechanism: Direct competitive inhibition of factor Xa (free and clot-bound), no antithrombin required

pharmacokinetics.half_life: 5-9 hours in healthy adults, longer in elderly/renal impairment

compass_trial.results: Reduced MACE and MALE, increased bleeding

vascular_surgery_applications.post_revascularization: Emerging evidence for use after peripheral intervention

reversal.pcc: 4-factor PCC can be used if andexanet unavailable
